meanings.definition: Forming or resembling a cumulus cloud.
meanings.sent1: The sky was filled with cumulous clouds on a sunny day.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted a beautiful picture of the cumulous sky.
meanings.sent3: The cumulous clouds looked like fluffy cotton candy in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts drifted like cumulous clouds in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The children lay on the grass, watching the cumulous clouds float by.

meanings.definition: Piled or stacked in a heap.
meanings.sent1: The books were cumulous on the shelf, waiting to be read.
meanings.sent2: The cumulous pile of laundry seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent3: She tripped over the cumulous mess of toys on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The cumulous stack of pancakes was too tall to finish.
meanings.sent5: The cumulous mound of pillows made the bed look cozy.
